result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon J. Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
May not have contact with Wal-Mart Store in Kenosha Co., unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon J. Ford

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

10:15 AM
Defendant Shannon J. Ford in court.
Attorney Alyssah M Foster in court for Shannon J. Ford.
Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State. 
Court Reporter:  Tracy Czarnecki-Kozmer.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defendant admits to prior convictions.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Retail Theft, Repeater;
Found guilty by the court.
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions;
9 days sentence credit if revoked.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
$1000 cash bond on deposit to be applied, remainder to poster.
Appeal rights given.

2:34 PM Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State. Attorney Alyssah M Foster in court for Shannon J. Ford. Clerk: HN. No appearance b DE. Atty reports DE is in the hospital and is trying to obtain proof. Atty requests adjournment.  Court adjourns. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
The 8/31/2022 Hearing has been rescheduled to 9/21/2022 at 2:30 pm at the request of the defense attorney.

08:52 AM
Defendant Shannon J. Ford appeared by phone means.
Attorney Alyssah M Foster appeared in court for the Defenant.
Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Def. unable to appear in person due to covid.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Due to repeater status, court adjourns the hrg so def. can appear in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
***DE HAS $200 ON DEPOSIT.  MUST POST ADDITIONAL $800 TO BE RELEASED.***
Continued posted
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Walmart in Kenosha.

132PM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry) - Deft has $200 cash on deposit and must post additional $800 in order to be released.  Deft remanded into custody of KSD.  kmk
and witness list filed by the State
